reviewText: As a gentleman with a bit of grey in my hair, I've been privileged to have seen almost every major act that came down the road. I saw this concert at another stop on the tour, and I must say I was completely and breathlessly KNOCKED OUT by Shakira's performance, on every professional and ethereal level. The atmosphere in the arena was as highly charged as I've ever experienced, and her entrance as you'll witness on this disc was dramatic, mysterious, sensual and almost otherworldly. When those lights hit the snake and the opening chords of Ojos Asi were struck... and as she began to move... and as she seemed to float forward to the mike... I'll tell you, it was a life moment, I'll never forget it. It was genuinely surreal. What was SO incredible, however, was that by the time the song was about to end and we had seen her movement, heard her voice, and felt the powerful and exotic wall of sound reduce to a simple violin phrase, the crowd was almost silent, as though dumbstruck. Few entrances and opening numbers have ever left me speechless... but this did. As to the DVD, it's A+ in every regard except for being the single most poorly edited video I've ever sat through. A blind editor would have done a better job. Otherwise the show is great, sound is great, camerawork when left alone for more than one second is good (this speed freak MTV five shots a second nonsense must end!), this woman has perhaps the most beautiful face since Bardot and she moves like an opium dream. Buy it and see why Britney and Christina cut their tours short - they obviously watched this DVD!
summary: Dear Shakira - It's Brilliant, but a few respectful comments
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had heard that her first US tour before "Laundry Service" was very lackluster,seemingly trying to figure herself out,not much interaction with the crowd. She had maybe 2 CDs (not counting her juvenalia like "Magia" from the early 90s) to her name. She was kind of seen as an Alanis Morrisette rip off, but wrote a lot of her own songs that gained her a strong Latina fanbase. A lot of those fans felt that when she crossed over in English (with the help of the Estefans), that she was kind of selling out.She seems to have found her stride as an arena rock performer, and the best chances of proving herself to not be a flash in the pan crossover. Some of the songs she had done in English on some shows she chose to do in Spanish in her live shows..The concert film looks and sounds great, even though she's in Rotterdam, you can hear some of the crowd singing along in Spanish. Because she has 3 CDs, she extended some of the songs into a 15 song set and does one cover (AC/DC "Back in Black")early in the show. It does have fast cutaways, but not as rapid fire as I've seen other editors do on live videos. There's more than enough going on on stage and the background screen that keeps it moving along without resorting to showing 10 camera angles in 5 seconds. Some of these directors really need to watch "The Last Waltz" and "Stop Making Sense" sometime.She pulls off all the songs in concert, the band sounds tight, and they all seem to be having fun along with the crowd.You have a one hour documentary of life on the road. There is some cursing and a softcore film being shown on the bus (Shakira's not in it *L*), but nothing too explicit.  You get to hear about her controversial relationship with her boyfriend (who was the son of the former president of Argentina)and some of her political views formed from growing up in Columbia, and her involvement in the children of Columbia's education. Her childhood friend is interviewed, her parents make an appearance on there, and talks about trying to make changes. It's good for people who don't really know all that much about her but like her music.Controversial writer Gabriel Garcia Marquez (1982 Nobel prize winner, writer of "100 Years of Solitude") also makes an appearance in the film for a few minutes. It's kind of a strange thing (something you'd expect with a band like U2 maybe) but seem to be pretty good friends that have known each other for a while..The extras are just the basic discography (which don't include her juvenalia-era albums) and a link to her website.She has yet to put out her videos on DVD. With the 10th anniversary of Pies Descalzos coming up as well as not one but 2 new CDs on the way, it would be great if she put out a video retrospective.The CD is good for listening to in the car, and the DVD at home, but with more DVDs in vehicles, more people will be bringing the video along... hopefully it won't cause any accidents when she does her dancing! The combo CD/DVD is a good deal, even though there are a few songs cut on the CD that are on the video.This is a good purchase for longtime fans of hers that cover her well known songs in Spanish from the first 2 CDs as well as the fans that got into "Laundry Service". I do think that it also serves its purpose in people wanting to see her when she tours again because you know it'll be even better.
summary: Coming into her own as a live performer.

reviewText: I love different kinds of music and I purchase many concerts on DVD and have seen many fair to good DVD presentations. But, Shakira: Live Off The Record is one of the greatest DVD concerts I own. Anyone readind this must know that Shakira is amazing beautiful and powerfuly sensual and steamy. She brings all her amazing body movements and raw sexuality to the stage in this DVD. The camera work is great and the stage show presented is top-dollar and fantastic! Shakira sings in English just a fraction more than she sings in Spanish in this concert but she is amazing no matter what language she vocalizes. The songs are mostly from Laundry Service and Oral Fixation Vol. 1 and she ads a few of her favorites like Back In Black (which she makes very sexy). Anyway, if you are even a little interested in Shakira, this is a great value for a DVD-CD combo. If you're already a fan... this is a no brainer until she comes out with a new concert featuring her work from Oral Fixation Vol. 2.
summary: WOW! A Concert DVD of the greatest quality!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: As you follow the opening, getting your Pasfoto's and your tickets to Rotterdam you are instantly transported back to 2003 to see Colombia's Shakira on tour. The introductions reveal an artist in full  Arabesque regalia that is quickly covered up in  a bathrobe to walk backstage before her triumphant entry. It is a long tease for you and the crowd as the hype and stage is set for  her grand entrance and your complete fascination. The rock guitar slowly gives way to the familiar violin  of "Ojos Asi " and the anticipation is driving the fans wild before the giant cobra prop reveals a  black leather clad beauty whose  light bare skin becomes even more sensous and dramatic  with the contrast. The drums trigger the mesmerizing belly dancing pelvis gyrations and then she begins singing as the crowd enthusiastically accompanies her. She is all performer, a singing sexy diva that is lovely and probably more talented(her written songs are poetic) than the other bubble gum flavor of the month varities around. The costume changes are several, beginning immediately after "Ojos Asi" with a long laced see through "cover up" that adds mystery although still revealing her mid section.She prances about , meanwhile you will remain under her hipnotic  spell knowing you missed the Tour of The Mongoose live but you've got the next best thing to being there. Shakira rocks, plain and simple. Comparisons to other  female artists are fair but she brings a unique larger than life stage presence equal to the male dominated rock Gods. She even plays some drums  and guitar on the set. Her version of the classic rock anthem "Back in Black" is introduced by a jazzy Shakira signature followed by  raucous guitar riffs  while her blonde curly  hair and hip thrusts are syncopated to the beat, oh yeah she sings a pretty mean version too! The performance is very visual but equally enticing with her  pronounced vibrato voice that is Shakira. Highlights of the DVD include the rousing opening with "Ojos Asi," her introduction drum solo on "Rules, " the outstanding interpretation of "Back in Black," her inspirational "Inevitable" that has Shakira  quitely rocking on guitar as the crowd shows it's satisfaction  by displaying lighters and singing along, the electronica tinged light show of "Ready For the Good Times" that features Shakira accompanying a bongo solo as she shakes her money maker to the delight of the fans, the full on belly dance groove on "Poem to a Horse" and of course the rousing crowd interacting  on "Whenever, Wherever." Then poof she is gone but the magic continues for you because there are plenty of extras. The documentary is very insightful to life on the road and dispells some of the myths associated with the so called glamour. Shakira explains the pain (hear her in excruciating pain) and fatigue that is part of the business as the show must go on.The documentary gives a peek into life on the road and also shows how she keeps grounded with her family. Her political slant is quickly evident as well as she explains her disapointment with not being able to play in the Middle East because of the war in Iraq and her commentary on her homeland Colombia. The concert footage in Colombia is fantastic although brief. The behind the scenes documentary is narrated by Shakira and also shows the creative song writing process. Shakira strips down to the human level revealing  her vulnerable side and explains the novela aspect of her desire to play Argentina, her being at odds with marketing and the business side of entertainment. She is after all an artist. She is a hands on perfectionist whose presence on stage is totally staged  to perfection. I found the documentary to be very good, touching at moments, hilarious at others and just an overall great snap shot of an international star. If the DVD weren't enough you also get a CD of the concert with the kept images in your mind. This is a great value where you get plenty of bang for your buck. Buy this DVD you won't be sorry, she is muy caliente (very hot) and will continue to be for quite some time.
summary: The Mongoose and The Cobra Tour
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been somewhat of a fan of Shakira's for a few years now. I've enjoyed her crossover hits (Whenever, Whereever; the twangy guitar-driven Objection (Tango); the very sexy La Tortura; and just recently the catchy Hips Don't Lie) and I've  always pumped up the volume when these hits came on the radio. But watching her Live & Off the Record dvd permanently made me a Shakira advocate and solidified her indelibly in my mind as one of our preeminent crossover celebrities and iconic musical stars.The camera smiles at Shakira. She is photogenic heaven. There's also no denying that she's supremely talented. She writes and produces, as well as performs. She plays multiple musical instruments. Her vocals are evocative, controlled and on point, effortlessly harnessing a breathy, girlish, sweet quality and then seamlessly switching to a power ballad forcefulness at the drop of a hat. And, of course, she's got her signature throaty vibrato. She knows how to sell a song with her expressive looks, her soulful sincerity, her playful and sometimes coy rapport with the audience, and her body language. God, her body language. This Columbian dream on legs dances almost as enticingly, as exotically as Aishwarya Rai. Rump shaking, thy name is Shakira. She throws full out commitment into her numbers, her graceful, sinuous uniquely-Shakira moves almost seem like performance art in their stylishness and boldness.Shakira: Live & Off the Record is a sweeeeet package. It contains a dvd and a cd of her 2003 Tour of the Mongoose concert in Rotterdam, Netherlands and showcases Shakira in all her captivating, booty-shaking, barefoot glory. If you're thinking of  Britney Spears or Jessica Simpson-style production values, you can forget it. Live & Off the Record is BIG and BALLSY music, more valid and entertaining than mere derivative pop music. Very ably backed by her talented 9-piece band (some very nice violin and guitar work here), she entrances the crowd from the get-go, from the  mezmerizing opening of Ojos Asi, rife with hot, serpentine belly-dancing, all the way to her spectacular closing number Whenever, Whereever, wherein she balances a candelabra on her noggin. In between, we are treated to a cool, sassy cover of AC/DC's Back in Black, a drum-happy Shakira which intros Rules, a heartfelt, audience-participatory Underneath Your Clothes, the cardio-techno stylings of Ready for the Good Times and her percussion-heavy rendition of Objection (Tango). Her Latin songs (Si Te Vas; the trumpet-backed Ciega, Sordomuda; Estoy Aqui; Octavo Dia; and Tu) are often slower in tempo, more power ballad-driven, yet they don't lose any energy or momentum in the delivery, and even seem to be more sincerely sung (understandably, she's more comfortable singing in Spanish). All throughout, she maintains that happy synergy between her and the audience and skillfully insinuates her own personal messages of peace and unity.The documentary is revealing and informative, frankly depicting the high and low points of someone of Shakira's star status, and the baggages and pressures that come with that. Particularly brutal to watch was a bed-ridden Shakira, after an arduous performance, writhing and sobbing in pain as she is tended to by her father (belly-dancing, as well as the other physicalities of her stage act, really takes its toll). One sweet sequence has mariachis serenading Shakira in Mexico on St. Valentine's Day.In a way, Shakira is like soccer. Out here in the States, she is a known commodity and fits a certain niche; she does well enough with her American fans. But, like futbol, Shakira is more than the sum of her popularity in the U. S. She is a worldwide phenomenon, universally more famous,loved, and  lauded. She makes a great ambassador for her native country of Columbia. Watch this release to realize how far reaching Shakira's impact and appeal truly are.The dvd numbers: Ojos Asi - Si Te Vas - Ciega, Sordomuda - The One - Back in Black - Rules - Inevitable - Estoy Aqui - Underneath Your Clothes - Octavo Dia - Ready For The Good Times - Tu - Poem To A horse - Objection (Tango) - Whenever, Wherever.The cd songs: Ojos Asi - Si Te Vas - Underneath Your Clothes - Ciega, Sordomuda - The One - Back In Black - Tu - Poem To A Horse - Objection (Tango) - Whenever, Whereever.

reviewText: One of the best imports of Columbia, most of the music here comes from her first English language hit, Dirty Laundry.  Great video of puppets looking somwhat like Saddam Hussin and George W. Bush.  There's also a great extra of Shakira somewhat interviewing herself and footage of her succesful tour.  A cd accompanies the dvd but doesn't have all the songs the dvd has.  Still, a lot of fun especially if you're a fan.

reviewText: Shakira exudes fun and exuberance, and this DVD does it's best to capture it.  Some might not like its music video stylings, the quick cuts and the light stylizing, but I felt this DVD offers exactly what you want from a live concert recording--a good smattering of hits, an excellent cover ("Back in Black") and a fair showcase of Shakira's talents, both singing and dancing.  The extra features are just that--extra.  Enjoy the DVD and CD.
summary: All you would expect from a live DVD

reviewText: I have always been a fan of Shakira's music but i never seen her perform live until this dvd. I cannot believe how good she was. I knew she was hot but when you see her do the belly roll thing on here, you need another word to descirbe it. She is an excellent dancer, and her vocals are flawless. She has a great voice and it stays that way the entire show. Most performers run out of breath because of there dancing, and it messes with there vocals, but not with Shakira. She sounds great throughout despite all the dancing she does. She performs all her hit songs, and i was just amazed. Her band does a great job as well. I love the intro with ojos asi. It was hot. And if the concert is not enough, you also get a documentery of what she goes through on the road for her world tour, as well as a live cd to alot of her songs. So it's definitely worth buying this dvd/cd. The second best thing next to being there in person.
summary: SHAKIRA KNOWS HOW TO PLEASE A CROWD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: Shakira knows how to do excellent concerts.She sings perfectly, her moves are great and her songs are meaning.We find all her recent hits, like "Whenever, Wherever", "Objection" and "Underneath your clothes", but there are also her older songs in Spanish like "Estoy Aqui", "Ciega, Sordomuda", "Si te vas", "Inevitable", "Tu" and so on...However, we can regret the fact that some songs don't appear on the DVD ("Fool", "Un Poco De Amor"...)The concert is very good, and so is the documentary about Shakira.This DVD is a good investment, which allows us to see the different faces of Shakira and her music.

reviewText: The DVD/CD live set is great, especially for all Shakira's fans all over the globe. Shakira is now an international superstar and I'm sure she still has her feet on the ground, in spite of all the attention media has given her. It's very cool to see a singer from Latin America receiving recognition for her work, as a true pop artist.On this concert, Shakira performs several hits of her career, and many songs from "Laundry service" album, her "crossover" CD, in english. I never saw Shakira live and I'm amazed with the DVD. "Ojos asi" is breath taking, with all that sexy bellydancing. I also enjoy her latin songs, such as "Inevitable", which is very touching, "Si te vas" and "Octavio dia". Shakira's performances in "The One" and "Underneath your clothes" are great! I think they should include in the DVD, as a bonus feature, "Suerte", which is fine and better than "Whenever, wherever".The documentary, which lasts 60 minutes, shows Shakira's busy life. There are also great interviews, proving that she is not a silly pop star, but a young woman who is aware of her role in this world.I liked the part in which she talked about Colombia's problems, showing a little bit of her native country.Shakira is now finishing her next CD. Let's wait...
summary: Shakira is now an international superstar!
